name: barnstormed
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
barnstorm
to travel to a lot of small towns and make political speeches to try to get people's votes or support: He plans to barnstorm across the state to generate public support.
In the past, to barnstorm was to travel to a lot of small towns and perform flying tricks in aircraft.
